DataElement.preferredName: Stage Prognostic Factor Derived Neoadjuvant Therapy Code
DataElement.preferredDefinition: This field indicates whether the patient received neoadjuvant therapy (systemic therapy or radiation therapy prior to first course surgical treatment) as part of first course of treatment.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Stage Prognostic Factor Derived Neoadjuvant Therapy
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The extent of a cancer in the body._Having value for making predictions._An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process._The source from which something comes or issues; to take, obtain, or receive from a source._Treatment designed to be used as a first step toward shrinking the cancer and in evaluating response to drugs and other agents. Induction therapy is followed by additional therapy to eliminate whatever cancer remains.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The extent of a cancer within the body, especially whether the disease has spread from the original site to other parts of the body.:The general personal and health characteristics that have a bearing on the course of a disease and its eventual outcome.

Concepts.definition: The extent of a cancer in the body.
The general personal and health characteristics that have a bearing on the course of a disease and its eventual outcome.

Property.preferredDefinition: To take, obtain, or receive from a source; having been determined by mathematical computation. :Treatment designed to be used as a first step toward shrinking the cancer and in evaluating response to drugs and other agents. Induction therapy is followed by additional therapy to eliminate whatever cancer remains.

Concepts.definition: The source from which something comes or issues; to take, obtain, or receive from a source.
Therapy administered prior to the primary treatment for the purpose of making the primary treatment more effective.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Top level term which includes Biological Markers, Risk Factors, and Prognostic Factors.

DataElementConcept.origin: NAACCR:North American Association of Central Cancer Registries

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: To take, obtain, or receive from a source; having been determined by mathematical computation._Treatment designed to be used as a first step toward shrinking the cancer and in evaluating response to drugs and other agents. Induction therapy is followed by additional therapy to eliminate whatever cancer remains._._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.
